Margaret,
 
Isn't this getting to be a real pain in the 
 
but we luv it!

bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ITCdeadpeople@ao=
l.comDate: Tue, 1 Apr 2008 19:36:09 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: New file up=
loaded to EVP-ITC




Thanks for the info, Bruce. I guess because I use suc=
h a wide variety of digital recorders, techniques, software, and settings, =
what I'm looking for is a way to catalog the session clips along with the d=
etails. This is not counting the MiniBox, 12-469, 12-470, either of my manu=
al sweep radios, or EVP Maker. So, like yourself, I too have much more than=
 "one box" to keep track of. I also have a variety of cameras/settings used=
 for ITC images. LOL - I'm in definite need of something "fancy." ;0)If I c=
an recall what the file is named, I can use the "spotlight" feature on my M=
AC to find it, though often the content of a single file is much longer tha=
n I could possible name it. For example, my recent results with EVP Maker/S=
peakJet Allophones. I do jot some things down in a Mead notebook, but even =
that can be a chore to go through when I'm wanting to find information that=
 is older.For example, without electronic organization, I can pull up a fil=
e and recall that I used Diamond Cut Live6/Forensics software, but if I can=
't refer to some kind of notes, there is no way I can recall what the speci=
fic settings were unless the session was recent and still fresh in my mind =
(and/or the notes easily found.)What I'm wanting is some kind of simple dat=
abase. It's looking more and more like I'm just going to have to buy the so=
ftware and create it. If I do, I'll be sure to share the template with othe=
rs who might also be interested.Margaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bru=
ce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > hi Margaret,> > I just=
 use a folder dedicated to the individual session > whatever files I get go=
 in, numbered in the order I got them from the recording.> > The main recor=
ding file gets named with the box used, date and session # if you use one.>=
 > these individual session folders are placed into a main folder, or you c=
ould create sub folders for each> month and place those in a main folder.> =
> I don't think you need anything fancy, especially since you are only usin=
g one box.> I use 5 different boxes and now EVPM so for me it could really =
get confusing.> > for you the simpler the better. If it's something like th=
is> > Main folder: box files/2008> > sub folders1: jan., feb., mar. so fort=
h.> > sub folders2: 469_session5_3-31-08> All files including main go into =
sub folders2> in turn that folder goes into the appropriate sub folder1> wh=
en the month is over that sub folder goes into the folder for the year.> > =
Say you wanted to reference a file from 3-31-08, you would know exactly wer=
e to find it.> > that's how I do it and it seems to work.> > bruce> Bruce H=
alliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: ITCdeadpeople@...: Tue, 1 Apr 2008 17:50:38 =
+0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: New file uploaded to EVP-ITC> > > > > Do you ha=
ve any kind of database of your clips, Steve? I have many good examples but=
 no organization (other than keeping the clips from a session, or a day, gr=
ouped together in the same folder). It's hard for me to keep track of every=
thing. Eons ago, I used to create simple databases with Filemaker Pro. I've=
 been thinking lately, I need to come up with something to use as reference=
s for the details for various clips. I'd be interested in knowing what, if =
anything, others are using. Margaret --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve=
 Hultay" <urkel23@> wrote:>> > Yeah, i only post the files if they have a c=
ertain meaning or are > really clear for others to listen. I probably avera=
ge about 15 files > in a 5 minute session, but will only post maybe 3 or 4.=
 If you do > enough sessions, the good files with start to add up.> > -Stev=
e H.> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@> =
> wrote:> >> > Hi Steve. Nice to hear you getting relevant responses with >=
 EVPM/allophones. Good one!> > > > Margaret > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com, EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com wrote:> > >> > > > > > Hello,> > > > > > T=
his email message is a notification to let you know that> > > a file has be=
en uploaded to the Files area of the EVP-ITC > > > group.> > > > > > File :=
 /Steve Hultay Files/Evp Maker > Files/yeah_take_off_reverse.mp3 > > > Uplo=
aded by : urkel232002 <urkel23@> > > > Description : "Yeah, Take Off Revers=
e" > > > > > > You can access this file at the URL:> > > http://groups.yaho=
o.com/group/EVP-> > ITC/files/Steve%20Hultay%20Files/Evp%20Maker%> 20Files/=
yeah_take_off_reverse.mp3 > > > > > > To learn more about file sharing for =
your group, please visit:> > > > http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/groups/or=
iginal/members/web/index.htm> lfiles> > > > > > Regards,> > > > > > urkel23=
2002 <urkel23@>> > >> >> > > > > > > > ____________________________________=
